greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = the n-th integer from among those positive integers which are coprime to n(n+1).
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: The positive integers which are coprime to (5*6) are 1,7,11,13,17,19,23,29,... The fifth of these integers is 17, so a(5) = 17.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = 0, c = n},While[c > 0,k++;While[GCD[n*(n + 1), k] > 1, k++ ];c--;];k];Table[f[n], {n, 65}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Nov 10 2006 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Nov 08 2006
